greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = gcd(n,3).
comment: For n>1: a(n) = GCD of the n-th and (n+2)-th triangular numbers = A050873(A000217(n+2), A000217(n)). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 28 2007
link: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,0,1).
formula: a(n) = 1 + 2*[3|n] = 1 + 2(1 + 2*cos(2*n*Pi/3))/3, where [x|y] = 1 when x divides y, 0 otherwise.
Multiplicative with a(p^e, 3) = gcd(p^e, 3). - _David W. Wilson_, Jun 12 2005
Dirichlet g.f. zeta(s)*(1+2/3^s). - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 08 2011
a(n) = 3^(1 - sgn(n mod 3)). - _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Jul 24 2016
mathematica: GCD[Range[0,100],3] (* or *) PadRight[{},110,{3,1,1}] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 28 2015 *)
xref: Cf. A178255 (decimal expansion of (3+sqrt(17))/2). - _Klaus Brockhaus_, May 24 2010
results.author: _Mitch Harris_
